title: Sources: Torn ACL ends USC star Watkins' season
content: USC's JuJu Watkins will miss the remainder of the women's NCAA tournament after suffering an ACL tear during the Trojans' second-round game Monday night.

title: Ward to Titans GM at pro day: 'Solidifying' top pick
content: Quarterback Cam Ward believes he solidified himself as the top pick in the 2025 NFL draft after throwing at Miami's pro day Monday.

title: Luka: It's on 'me and Bron' to recharge Lakers
content: The struggles continued for Los Angeles on Monday, as Luka Doncic and the Lakers dropped a 118-106 decision to the Orlando Magic, a seventh loss in the past 10 games for a club that has just 11 games remaining to get back in a rhythm before the playoffs.

title: Celtics star Tatum exits with left ankle sprain
content: Celtics star Jayson Tatum left Monday's game with a left ankle sprain after taking a hard foul. He told ESPN's Ramona Shelburne his ankle was "just sore" but that the team would be cautious.

title: UConn's Bueckers stars in 'amazing' Storrs finale
content: UConn's Paige Bueckers, a three-time All-American and the presumptive No. 1 overall pick in next month's WNBA draft, played in her final home game Monday night, a 91-57 victory over South Dakota State that pushed the Huskies into the NCAA's Sweet 16.

title: Blatter, Platini cleared in FIFA corruption case
content: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter and France great Michel Platini were both cleared of corruption charges by a Swiss court on Tuesday.

title: Terps 'never gave up,' seal Sweet 16 bid in 2OT
content: Sarah Te-Biasu made a tying 3-pointer in the fourth quarter, then scored eight of her 26 points in the second overtime to help fourth-seeded Maryland outlast fifth-seeded Alabama 111-108 on Monday to advance to the Sweet 16 of the women's NCAA tournament.

title: AD: 'No doubt' about return to help hobbled Mavs
content: Anthony Davis had 2 points, 6 rebounds, 3 assists, a steal and a block in 26 minutes in his return, a blowout victory over the Nets.

title: UNLV finalizing deal to hire Pastner, sources say
content: UNLV is finalizing what is expected to be a five-year deal to hire Georgia Tech's Josh Pastner as the school's next men's basketball coach.

title: 'Two lions are better than one': The Warriors' season hinges on an unlikely friendship
content: Butler faces the Miami Heat on Tuesday for the first time since the trade that sent him to Golden State on Feb. 5.

title: NBA could be headed for 'worst tanking stretch we've ever seen'
content: Teams are getting really good at tanking. Can the league stop it? Here's what's next for the race to the bottom.

title: MLB season megapreview: Power Rankings, playoff odds and everything you need for all 30 teams
content: Whether your team enters Opening Day as a favorite or hoping to be 2025's big surprise, we've got you covered.

title: 'Gotta carry it like a battle scar': Can Yankees bounce back from fifth-inning World Series nightmare?
content: Starting with their historic Game 5 meltdown, the road to Opening Day in the Bronx has been a rough one.

title: Who are the toughest first-round opponents for the Capitals, Jets?
content: The conference leaders meet Tuesday; what do their postseason paths look like? Plus, full playoff projections.

title: New NFL mock draft ... with a twist: Tannenbaum makes all 32 first-round picks through a GM lens
content: Mike Tannenbaum puts his GM hat on and makes his own first-round selections. See why he's taking Cam Ward and Ashton Jeanty early.

title: 'There are no final victories': Harry Edwards is still fighting the good fight
content: Though slowed by terminal cancer, the acclaimed sociologist and athlete activist remains a vital resource.

title: Post-free-agency NFL Power Rankings: How all 32 teams stack up, plus under-the-radar moves
content: Which NFL teams improved this offseason, and which took a step back? Our panel of experts ranked them from 1 to 32.

title: NWSL condemns alleged abuse of Pride's Banda
content: The NWSL and NJ/NY Gotham FC are investigating "hateful language" directed from a fan toward Orlando Pride's Barbra Banda during a match on Sunday.

title: Tuchel: Subbed Bellingham over fear of red card
content: England's Thomas Tuchel said he substituted Jude Bellingham during the 3-0 win against Latvia to prevent the midfielder from being sent off.

title: Alajuelense blasts Concacaf for backing León
content: Costa Rican team Liga Deportiva Alajuelense condemned Concacaf president Victor Montagliani after he expressed his full support for Club León in their legal fight against FIFA for being removed from the 2025 Club World Cup.

title: Source: Chelsea can return Sancho for $6.5m
content: Chelsea will have to pay Manchester United a fee of £5 million if they back out of the deal to sign Jadon Sancho permanently this summer, a source has told ESPN.

title: Yamal hits back at Van der Vaart after Spain win
content: Lamine Yamal has quipped back at Rafael van der Vaart's "pants down" jibe after helping Spain beat Netherlands in Sunday's UEFA Nations League quarterfinal.

title: Boehly: Chelsea owners could split over stadium
content: Todd Boehly has suggested the consortium group which owns Chelsea could split if an agreement on the situation surrounding Stamford Bridge isn't reached.

title: Brazil's Dorival, Ancelotti discuss Endrick progress
content: Brazil coach Dorival Júnior has revealed he has had a long talk with Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti regarding Endrick's progress.

title: Gotham sign Geyse on loan from Man United
content: NJ/NY Gotham FC has acquired forward Geyse on loan from Manchester United just weeks after the Brazilian posted on her Instagram that being at United left her with an "agonizing and lonely feeling."

title: Can Florida State bounce back from its disastrous 2024 season?
content: Mike Norvell has made myriad adjustments since the end of his team's disastrous campaign. But will they be enough?

title: Inside the incredibly high-risk, low-reward LeBron James bet
content: LeBron James' streak of scoring 10 points in a game continues, but with significant money on the line each game, two people are paying attention to this trend more than most.

title: Why George Foreman will be remembered as 'That Guy'
content: George Foreman was a champion, but for a lot of nonboxing fans, he will be remembered for so much more.

title: Can anyone break Sean Brady's grip on welterweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: Divisional rankings: Fundora retains No. 2 spot with TKO win
content: Sebastian Fundora defended his junior middleweight titles with a TKO win over Chordale Booker. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Keeping up with Nolan and Jared Jones, and other weekend news
content: Eric Karabell keeps tabs on the baseball world and tells you what is relevant to fantasy baseball managers.

title: Red Bull's Lawson predicament is a mess of its own making
content: Red Bull had a Sergio Pérez replacement in house. Instead, it chose Liam Lawson, who's underwhelmed in 2025.

title: Ferrari's Shanghai debacle: Explaining Hamilton, Leclerc DQs
content: Why were both Ferraris disqualified in China, and how costly could that be in the constructors' title fight?

title: Lewis Hamilton dons red on historic EA Sports F1 25 Iconic Edition cover
content: The newly minted Ferrari driver takes the spotlight on the Iconic Edition with his first-ever solo appearance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to let 10 leave, sign Akcicek
content: Manchester United fans can ready themselves for a big summer with 10 players ready to leave. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Premier League stars are tough, but criticism can hurt them and their loved ones
content: In his latest column, ESPN FC analyst and ex-Man City defender Nedum Onuoha reveals how much attention players pay to all the negative talk about them.

title: France fix issues, reach Nations League finals. Next? World Cup
content: France have belief to go with their talent and, after righting the ship to beat Croatia, can look toward 2026.

title: Waiver wire pickups: Stephon Castle among surging rookies to add
content: The fantasy basketball waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Aaliyah Chavez's unlikely route to top girls basketball prospect
content: As a college decision looms, the sought-after point guard reflects on a late start but quick rise in the game.

title: Election for four GCC ward councillor posts to be held in May: TNSEC
content: A total of 133 vacancies in urban local bodies in 35 districts and 315 vacancies in rural local bodies in nine districts will also be filled

title: Delhi Budget 2025-26: Budget announcements at a glance
content: This is the first Budget presented by a BJP-led government in Delhi in over 26 years, following the party’s victory over the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in last month’s Assembly elections.

title: Paddy procurement to resume finally in Kottayam
content: At a meeting convened by District Collector John V. Samuel, officials decide to resume paddy procurement, ending the stand-off between farmers and mill owners. To expedite the process, the remaining stock of paddy harvested from fields under the Thiruvarppu agriculture office will be procured immediately in accordance with existing contractual terms

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation Budget: thrust on basic infrastructure, welfare measures
content: The Budget proposes ₹1,928.35 crore expenditure for the year, a jump of around ₹226 crore from the previous year, and a projected surplus of ₹257.64 crore. One of the biggest allocations is for waste management at ₹300 crore.

title: Headmaster of government school in Pudukottai suspended for consuming liquor in campus
content: There were also complaints that the headmaster was irregular to the elementary school which had only seven students.

title: Budget provides ‘marginal relief’ for those taxpayers whose income exceeds ₹12 lakh p.a., says Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announces unprecedented tax relief and realistic growth projections in personal income tax collection.

title: "Think Even BJP Doesn't Like Eknath Shinde": Kunal Kamra To NDTV Amid Row
content: Doubling down on his remarks against Maharashtra Deputy Chief Eknath Shinde, which have triggered a massive row, comedian Kunal Kamra has said the Shiv Sena chief is not liked even by members of his ally, the BJP.

title: "Get Well Soon": Filmmaker vs Kangana Ranaut Over Kunal Kamra Row
content: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta and actor-MP Kangana Ranaut clashed online today over the crackdown against stand-up comic Kunal Kamra for his jokes targeting Shiv Sena chief Eknath Shinde.

title: Bangladesh Coup? Rumours Swirl After Army Chief's Meetings, Terror Warning
content: Social media is abuzz with rumours of a coup in Bangladesh after recent political developments and the deployment of military personnel and security forces across the country, especially in Dhaka.

title: "You Made 'Sheeshmahal', We Will...": BJP's Budget Jab At Arvind Kejriwal
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta fired 'sheeshmahal' jabs - a redux of barbs fired in campaigning for last month's Assembly election - at predecessor Arvind Kejriwal and his AAP Tuesday, as she presented a Rs 1 lakh crore budget for 2025/26.

title: 'Muskaan Slit Throat, Sahil Severed Head': Chilling Meerut Murder Details
content: In another chilling revelation in Meerut's Saurabh Rajput murder case, police have found that eight days before the crime, Saurabh's wife and prime accused Muskaan Rastogi bought two knives for Rs 800 and rehearsed how to stab multiple times

title: Kunal Kamra Seeks More Time From Cops, Posts Sena Vandalism Visuals
content: Kunal Kamra, who is at the centre of a political firestorm after posting a satirical song on Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, has sought a week's time to appear before the Mumbai Police in connection with the case filed against him.

title: Canada Cites "India's Growing Global Influence" In Allegation Against Pak
content: Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) said Pakistan could conduct foreign interference activities against Canada.

title: Ex-World Champion Boxer Attacks Husband Amid Divorce Proceedings - Video
content: Former World Champion boxer Saweety Boora was caught on camera assaulting her husband - Kabaddi player Deepak Niwas Hooda - amid divorce proceedings.

title: Opinion: Is It Payback Time For Pakistan Army?
content: Reports from Pakistani think-tanks have already highlighted 2024 as the worst year on record in a decade in terms of terror attacks; the graph is likely to only rise this year.

title: Shihan Hussaini, Actor Who Once 'Crucified' Self For Jayalalithaa, Dies
content: Shihan Hussaini, who was known affectionately known as 'Hu', had been documenting his cancer journey by giving constant updates on his social media accounts.

title: Expat Flies To India After UK Hospital Delays His Hand Surgery, Shares Post
content: In an Instagram video,Aryan Mangal shared that he suffered a severe injury in the UK when a glass shattered on his hand.

title: Sanjiv Goenka Breaks Silence Amid Buzz Over Chat With Pant After Loss vs DC
content: It was a disappointing start to the IPL 2025 campaign for Lucknow Super Kings and captain Rishabh Pant.

title: "Supari" For Comedy? Conspiracy Probe After Kunal Kamra Mocks Eknath Shinde
content: Mumbai Police are investigating if Kunal Kamra's jokes targeting Shiv Sena chief Eknath Shinde were part of a conspiracy and whether the comic received money or any other form of help to mock the Maharashtra Chief Minister, sources have said.

title: SC to hear pleas for implementation of 2006 verdict on police reforms in May
content: Lawyer Prashant Bhushan and senior advocate Dushyant Dave told a Bench comprising Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna and Justices Sanjay Kumar and KV Viswanathan that the apex court guidelines were being flouted by various State governments.

title: Supreme Court disposes over 20-year-old PIL for conservation, restoration of Red Fort
content: A bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh disposed of the plea filed by petitioner Rajeev Sethi in 2003, claiming that the conservation of the monument was not done as per the international standard.

title: Madhumita Shukla murder case: SC dismisses plea challenging premature release of Amarmani Tripathi
content: Poet Madhumita, who was pregnant, was shot dead on May 9, 2003, in the Paper Mill Colony, Lucknow. Amarmani Tripathi was arrested in September 2003 in connection with the murder of the poet with whom he was allegedly in a relationship

title: India losing 3% of GDP annually due to road accidents: Gadkari
content: Mr. Gadkari said every year India sees 4,80,000 accidents, which lead to 1,88,000 deaths of people aged between 18 and 45 years

title: Nithari killings: SC to hear on April 3 pleas challenging Surendra Koli's acquittal
content: The apex court had last year agreed to examine separate pleas, including those filed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Uttar Pradesh government, challenging the Allahabad High Court's decision acquitting Koli on October 16, 2023

title: Army rejects social media post's claims that China hacked its aircraft
content: A recent social media post alleged that an RPA of the Indian Army had "veered" into the Chinese territory in the eastern theatre.

title: Disha Salian case: Father seeks FIR against Aaditya Thackeray and others
content: The petition demanded the registration of an FIR against Aaditya Thackeray and transferring the probe to the CBI

title: T.N. CM Stalin misrepresenting three-language policy as Hindi imposition, alleges Annamalai
content: In a post on X, Mr. Annamalai said, “By misrepresenting the policy as an attempt to impose Hindi, the Chief Minister has reinforced the DMK’s hidden agenda that only those who can afford to learn multiple languages should have the access to it.”

title: Child Care is a fundamental service not a luxury: RS MP
content: NCP (Sharad Pawar) MP Fauzia Khan flagging the viral photograph of an RPF constable patrolling the station with her one-year-old child strapped to her chest, said that Nari Shakti should go beyond optics

title: Stock markets extend winning run to seventh day; Sensex edges up 32 points
content: The 30-share BSE benchmark Sensex gained 32.81 points or 0.04% to settle at 78,017.19. During the day, it jumped 757.31 points or 0.97% to 78,741.69

title: Your insecurity has not only made you bitter but blinded you: Kangana, Hansal Mehta spar over Kunal Kamra remark
content: “Was her house vandalised? Did goons enter her premises? Did they do this to challenge her freedom of expression or for alleged FSI violations? Please enlighten me,” said filmmaker Hansal Mehta over Kangana Ranuat’s remark

title: Remove Conocarpus trees: Assembly Speaker suggests Telangana Govt
content: The Speaker said significant chunk of saplings planted during Harita Haaram programme were of Conocarpus

title: Days after Bengaluru realtor was found murdered, police arrest wife, mother-in-law
content: The police found the body of Lokanath Singh, 37, a realtor, with a stab injury on his neck near an under-construction site on March 22.

title: Intermediate first year admissions from April 7 in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Board will start sale of application forms on April 1, 2025, the admission process will start on April 7, date of completion of the admissions is May 31

title: Chhattisgarh Ends Gender Bias In Language Of Adoption Law
content: The Chhattisgarh government has made a significant amendment to the century-old Adoption Act, replacing the term 'adopted son' with 'adopted child' in all legal documents.

title: ATM Withdrawals To Get Costlier From May 1: Check New Charges
content: While the financial transactions get expensive by Rs 2, the non-financial transactions, such as balance inquiries, will cost an extra rupee from May 1.

title: Depleting Soil Health: The Price of Growing Water-Guzzling Crops
content: States primarily growing water-intensive crops have more depleted soil, with lower levels of macro and micronutrients like nitrogen, iron, zinc and sulphur.

title: Stage set for Ugadi Mahotsavams at Srisailam
content: The processional deities of Goddess Bhramaramba and Lord Mallikarjuna Swamy will be taken out on vahana sevas on the first three days and on the last day

title: History-sheeter distributes prizes in panchayat school event near Ambur; probe on
content: The inquiry was conducted with the school authorities for permitting the history-sheeter to give away prizes to students and perform film songs at the school event

title: Party is not yours but that of your husband: Nitish Kumar in fresh spat with Rabri Devi
content: Rabri Devi rose in protest against the derision of her party, only to be snubbed by Mr. Kumar with the remark, in Bihari slang, "You just stay out of this. The party is not yours but that of your husband"

title: Minister Narayana inspects Amaravati Capital construction, assures completion without burdening public
content: The Minister confirmed that 90% of the tendering process for capital city construction had been completed, with initial work beginning with jungle clearing

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta presents ₹1 lakh crore ‘historic budget’; women empowerment, infrastructure key focus areas
content: This is the first Budget presented by a BJP-led government in Delhi in over 26 years, following the party's victory over the AAP in the 2025 Assembly elections

title: India slaps Samsung with tax demand of ₹5,156 crore for telecom imports
content: Samsung “violated” Indian laws and “knowingly and intentionally presented false documents before the customs authority for clearance,” said an official

title: Police to crackdown on betting
content: Police teams are trying to track those who organise betting and those who encourage others to indulge in the betting activity, say police officials

title: A.P. government to conduct mega DSC in April, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The government will launch the ‘Thalliki Vandanam’ scheme in May, under which ₹15,000 will be given per child, and the financial assistance under this scheme will be provided before schools reopen, he said

title: Parliament to discuss new Income Tax Bill in Monsoon Session: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Ms. Sitharaman said the new Income Tax Bill is currently being vetted by the Select Committee and it is has been mandated to submit its report by the first day of the next session

title: Kerala to withdraw controversial order fixing buffer zone around dams
content: Water Resources department issued order on December 26 fixing guidelines for issuance of no objection certificate for construction activities in the vicinity of reservoirs under it

title: 17th edition of ‘Yoga Stops Traffick’ to be held globally on March 29
content: Initiative by Mysuru-based Odanadi Seva Samsthe to use yoga as a humanitarian tool against human trafficking and sexual exploitation

title: A.P. inks pact with Cisco to enhance digital skills development in State
content: The collaboration is expected to play a pivotal role in preparing students and workforce with the necessary skills to seize opportunities in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and emerging technologies for future jobs

title: “Huge deficit” in R&B Dept allocation leads to interesting debate in Telangana Assembly
content: Former R&B Minister said only ₹4,935 Cr allocated while over ₹16,200 Cr is required. Current R&B Minister says BRS has no right to speak about RRR

title: Unnao rape case: Supreme Court refuses to withdraw CRPF security cover of survivor
content: The Supreme Court, however, removed CRPF security cover given to Unnao rape survivor’s family members and other witnesses noting that conviction has already taken place

title: T.N. CM Stalin to soon make announcement to protect Tamils and their language
content: Mr. Stalin said: “We are under compulsion to take steps to protect federalism and secure the autonomy of States.”

title: Kerala Assembly passes Private Universities Bill, scripts a milestone in State’s educational landscape
content: Pivotal legislation opens the doors to private universities in Kerala, nearly a decade after the idea was first proposed

title: Madras High Court judges recuse from hearing TASMAC cases against ED search, seizure operation
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and N. Senthilkumar direct the Madras High Court Registry to list the cases before the alternate Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar

title: Shashi Tharoor recites poem in Parliament to critique taxation
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Monday turned to poetry in the Lok Sabha to sharply criticise the Modi government’s taxation policy.

title: Separatism has become history in Kashmir: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on March 25, welcomed the announcement of J&K People’s Movement and Democratic Political Movement to severe ties with separatism.

title: Hyderabad’s NIMS urologists perform robotic kidney transplant on young patient battling end-stage renal disease
content: The procedure which costs ₹20 lakh at a corporate hospital, was performed free of charge under Aarogyasri Scheme

title: Walayar parents asked to appear before CBI court on April 25
content: Incidentally, Kerala High Court on Monday issued notices to CBI on a petition filed by the parents seeking to quash chargesheets against them

title: Odisha Assembly suspends 12 Congress MLAs for seven days over ‘indiscipline’ in House
content: BJD and Congress members are alleging that the BJP government has failed to ensure safety of women and justice to the ST, SC and OBC people.

title: VACB clears Kerala ADGP Ajith Kumar of corruption charges levelled by P.V. Anvar
content: Officials note that if government accepts VACB’s report, it can lead to Ajith Kumar’s potential inclusion in UPSC shortlist of candidates eligible for elevation as Kerala’s State Police Chief

title: Delhi High Court reserves order on MP Rashid’s plea to attend Parliament in custody
content: The court deliberated on certain conditions which could be imposed on Rashid in case the plea is allowed, including that the Lok Sabha Speaker could be requested to grant special permission to a police official to accompany the independent Baramulla MP in Parliament premises

title: Wayanad landslides: Decks cleared for laying foundation stone for township for survivors on March 27
content: Township to come up on 65 hectares of land at Kalpetta in Wayanad. Kerala government has proposed to hand over ₹26 crore as compensation to Elstone Estate owners

title: Supreme Court to hear Katchatheevu case on September 15
content: Supreme Court allows DMK leader to replace Karunanidhi in challenge against India-Sri Lanka agreements over Katchatheevu

title: Betting on IPL matches taking place under Mumbai police's protection, claims Maharashtra LoP Danve
content: ‘I have a pen drive that contains phone call details of an application called ‘Lotus 24’ used for betting on cricket matches,’

title: India top milk producer in the world: Animal Husbandry Minister
content: ‘India has now set a target of producing 300 million metric tons of milk in next five years,’ says  Union Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh in the Lok Sabha

title: 'You made Sheesh Mahal, we will build houses for poor': CM Rekha's jibe at Kejriwal
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta criticized ex-CM Arvind Kejriwal, accusing AAP of failed promises, during her Rs 1 lakh crore budget presentation. Promoting Delhi as a tourism hub and revamping education are key goals, with significant funds for infrastructure. Gupta pledged housing and facilities for the poor, including modern cow shelters and a new jail outside the city.

title: Kannada actress Ranya Rao admitted to hawala transactions, DRI tells court
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao admitted to sending money through hawala, as revealed by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) in court. The case involves allegations of gold smuggling, with Ranya found carrying 14.2 kg of gold at Bengaluru’s airport. The Karnataka government appointed Gaurav Gupta to investigate the possible involvement of her stepfather, Ramachandra Rao.

title: Sanjay Raut says Kamra shares his DNA, Shiv Sena calls both 'mad'
content: Sanjay Raut has supported comedian Kunal Kamra amid backlash for calling Eknath Shinde a 'gaddar' during a comedy show. Kamra's comments were in reference to Shinde's 2022 rebellion which led to the Uddhav Thackeray government's fall. Maharashtra junior home minister and BJP MLC criticized Kamra, while Shiv Sena workers vandalized a hotel related to Kamra's performance.

title: 'Axar must send Ashutosh to open if DC want IPL glory'
content: Ashutosh Sharma's stellar performance for Delhi Capitals in IPL 2025, highlighted by an unbeaten 66 off 31 balls, played a crucial role in their one-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Former cricketer Amay Khurasiya advocates for him to open innings, emphasizing his versatility and potential as a match-winner and future India T20 player.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk: 'No more loans to...' as DOGE fights loan fraud
content: Elon Musk supports the new SBA policy to prevent fraud involving stolen Social Security numbers, requiring applicants’ date of birth for direct loans. Measures include halting loans for those under 18 or over 120 years old, addressing past fraudulent cases and improving data integrity in federal loan programs.

title: Karnataka minister Rajanna to file complaint over alleged honeytrap attempt
content: Karnataka cooperation minister K N Rajanna intends to file a complaint regarding an alleged honeytrap attempt. He is to meet home minister G Parameshwara and has prepared a detailed complaint on the incident. Rajanna also mentioned that multiple politicians across parties have been targeted by such schemes.

title: Zelenskyy's last-minute choice of 'wrong gift' led to Oval Office spat?
content: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy intended to gift the championship belt to President Trump but chose to show graphic images of Ukrainian prisoners instead. This altered the meeting's tone, leading to an argument. Despite the tense outcome, Zelenskyy emphasized the importance of displaying his values over the symbolic gift, defending Ukraine's dignity during the conversation.

title: Kunal Kamra on CEO Bhavish Aggarwal: Take Ola guy, for example. What did I ...
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra reignited his feud with Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal during a show in Mumbai, mocking Aggarwal's handling of customer complaints and technical issues. The comedian criticized Aggarwal's focus on scooter colours and referenced their ongoing disputes, including Aggarwal’s management tactics and political connections. He said Aggarwal should prioritise refunds for customers over offering him money.

title: Senators slam Trump admin over reported plan to share sensitive taxpayer data
content: US senators are alarmed by reports that DHS and DOGE seek unprecedented access to IRS taxpayer data, which may target vulnerable communities, including immigrants. They demand transparency regarding any planned data-sharing agreements, citing potential violations of taxpayer privacy laws and negative impacts on IRS trust and enforcement.

title: TMC MP calls Shivraj Singh Chouhan 'dalal', BJP hits back
content: Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee accused Union minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan of favoring the wealthy and denying West Bengal's central funds for schemes like MGNREGA. Banerjee suggested this was because the BJP failed to form a government in the state. BJP countered this, demanding an apology and insisting there’s no discrimination against states.

title: 'No right to lecture': Himanta slams Congress over 'Maoist-style' attack in assembly
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma criticized the Congress party for an alleged attack on deputy speaker Numal Momin by Congress MLAs, stating they have no right to lecture on freedom of expression. Momin claimed he was attacked in a 'Maoist style' and filed an FIR. The confrontation occurred while Congress MLAs protested BJP MLA Rupjyoti Kurmi's conduct.

title: Shark Tank’s Anupam Mittal on IPL 2025: May be time to replace bowlers with…
content: Anupam Mittal, Shark Tank India judge, commented on the IPL 2025 season, suggesting that it heavily favors batsmen with high scores dominating games. He humorously proposed replacing bowlers with machines. The 18th edition of IPL began on March 22 and features 74 matches. Mittal also discussed leveraging India's UPI to challenge global payment giants like Visa and Mastercard.

title: 'Action causes reaction': Shinde on vandalism by Sena workers over Kunal Kamra's joke
content: Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde criticized comedian Kunal Kamra's joke calling him a 'gaddar,' stating there should be limits on freedom of speech. The controversy led to vandalism by Shiv Sena workers, legal actions, and political debates, with Kamra refusing to apologize.

title: 'Game is not over until Ashutosh is batting': KP hails match-winner
content: Ashutosh Sharma shone in the IPL 2025, scoring an unbeaten 66 off 31 balls to secure Delhi Capitals' victory against Lucknow Super Giants. Despite a cut finger, he played with determination. Coach Hemang Badani praised his resolve, and mentor Kevin Pietersen lauded his mindset. Delhi Capitals, struggling at 65/5, triumphed with Sharma's composure.

title: Man shares how he lost 19 kilos in 3 months without gym & full-time job
content: In 2025, Samvit Mishra successfully lost 19 kg in three months by focusing on sustainable lifestyle changes, including a balanced diet of natural foods and maintaining an active routine of stair climbing and cycling. Despite initial cravings, he made healthier food choices without relying on crash diets or gym memberships.

title: Erode history-sheeter murder: One more surrenders in court, five arrested
content: John alias Chanakya, 35, of Kitchipalayam in Salem city, was hacked to death by a four-member gang on the highway in front of his wife Saranya, while they were travelling by car from Salem to Tiruppur

title: Kathua encounter: Massive search operation to track down militants enters third day in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Massive search operation in Kathua forest to track down terrorists, led by DGP Nalin Prabhat, continues for third day

title: Kunal Kamra controversy: Eknath Shinde reacts to comedian’s remarks, likens it to taking ‘supari’ to speak against a person
content: The Deputy CM highlighted several welfare initiatives, including the 'Ladki Bahin' scheme, the 'Lakhpati Didi' scheme, and the decision to make education free for girls.

title: Justice Yashwant Varma transfer: Allahabad High Court Bar Association begins indefinite strike
content: ‘Our fight is against those involved in corruption and against a system that lacks transparency. For now, our demand is a reconsideration and withdrawal of the transfer order (of Justice Yashwant Varma),’ says Allahabad Bar Association president Anil Tiwari

title: Shihan Hussaini, actor and karate instructor, no more
content: Shihan Hussaini, 65-year-old karate expert and archer, founded The Archery Association of Tamil Nadu (TAAT) and also served as its general secretary for several years

title: Groundwater level dipped in Afzalpur, Aland, Chincholi, but rose in Kamalapur taluk in Kalaburagi district
content: According to the data provided by the Ground Water Directorate, Aland taluk recorded an alarmingly dip in water level from 15.98 mbgl in 2014 to 29.48 mbgl in 2024

title: 4 KSU activists arrested in Kerala’s Palakkad for attempting to kill student over Facebook post comment
content: Victim was assaulted over his comment on Facebook post regarding a college festival video uploaded by another student, according to FIR

title: ‘Look forward to fostering stronger ties with partners in U.K.’: Mamata Banerjee
content: Speaking at the High Commission of India in London where she attended a high-tea reception, Mamata Banerjee called the relationship “very deep” as pre-independence, Kolkata served as the capital of India

title: BJP-Sena alliance in 2014 broke due to dispute over four Assembly seats: Fadnavis
content: The two parties contested the 2014 State polls separately, but the Shiv Sena joined hands with the BJP after the elections when it formed its government under Fadnavis' leadership

title: Mumbai police issues notice to Kunal Kamra
content: Mumbai Police issue notice to comedian Kunal Kamra after FIR for remarks against Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister

title: Lok Sabha approves motion to extend tenure of JPC on 'One Nation, One Election'
content: Lok Sabha extends JPC tenure for ‘One Nation, One Election’ bills; committee to meet today at 3 p.m. with legal experts

title: Cheetah mother, cubs pelted with stones in Madhya Pradesh village
content: Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forests and Project Cheetah Director Uttam Kumar Sharma urged people not to panic and allow the animals to move freely

title: Three Maoists killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
content: One of the slain Maoists has been identified as Dandakaranya Special Zonal Committee Member Sudhir alias Sudhakar alias Murali, a resident of Warangal district, Telangana, who was carrying a reward of ₹25 lakh on his head, police say

title: Howrah subsidence: Suvendu Adhikari, Minister Firhad Hakim visit site as anger simmers among residents
content: Locals, particularly women, continued to protest highlighting the lack of basic facilities, including no water and lack of housing; the subsidence has resulted in collapse of houses and disruption of water supply in the locality situated near a garbage dump

title: TMC to take disciplinary action against MLAs skipping assembly sessions
content: TMC lawmakers face disciplinary action for repeated absenteeism in West Bengal Assembly, with strict measures being taken

title: Telangana: Second body found and extricated at SLBC site, one month after tunnel collapse
content: The victim was identified as Manoj Kumar, Project Engineer hailing from Uttar Pradesh. The first of the eight missing bodies was found on March 9

title: Kunal Kamra shares clips of Shiv Sena protests in apparent dig at joke row
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra has responded to the vandalism of his performance venue by Shiv Sena workers. The incident followed Kamra's parody about Maharashtra's deputy chief minister Eknath Shinde and other political figures in his recent YouTube video. Kamra asserted his right to freedom of speech while criticizing the attack.

title: BJP plans 'Saugat-e-Modi' for minorities, opposition calls it poll gimmick
content: The BJP plans to launch the 'Saugat-e-Modi' campaign, distributing special kits to Muslims and minorities during festivals. The initiative, which begins in Delhi, aims to reach 32 lakh underprivileged Muslims nationwide. However, the opposition accuses the BJP of using the campaign as a political strategy ahead of elections in Bihar.

title: 'Drugged him & stabbed in neck': How wife, her mother killed Bengaluru man
content: A woman and her mother are accused of killing a realtor in Bengaluru due to years of harassment. The realtor, with a history of deceit, had forced his way into the woman's life and continued to torment her and her family, prompting them to retaliate.

title: INDIA bloc used George Soros's money in Lok Sabha polls: Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath accused Congress and its allies of using billionaire George Soros's funds to influence the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, labeling it treason. He also criticized the Congress-led Karnataka government for implementing a religion-based reservation quota and defended his governance approach.

title: 'Single le raha tha, chauka maar gaya': Pant & Axar tease Kuldeep - Watch
content: Delhi Capitals achieved a thrilling one-wicket win over Lucknow Super Giants in their IPL 2025 opener. Kuldeep Yadav's crucial boundary and Ashutosh Sharma's unbeaten 66 were pivotal, while the on-field camaraderie between DC's Axar Patel, Kuldip Yadav, and LSG's Rishabh Pant showcased a lighthearted spirit despite their rivalry. DC successfully chased a target of 210 runs.

title: Australia Budget: Tax cuts, student debt relief — All you need to know
content: The Australian government has announced the 2025-26 federal budget, emphasizing cost-of-living relief, tax cuts, and support for households, students, and businesses. Key measures include tax rate reductions, energy bill relief, student debt forgiveness, and healthcare investments, amidst concerns over fiscal deficits and housing affordability.

title: India eyes tariff cuts on over half of US imports worth $23 bn, says report
content: India plans to reduce tariffs on over 50% of US imports worth $23 billion under a new trade agreement to prevent reciprocal tariffs. Negotiations are set to address these changes, with India pursuing balanced reforms and seeking relief from potential US tariffs.

title: Watch: DC celebrate Rahul's fatherhood with special dressing room tribute
content: Delhi Capitals achieved a thrilling one-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, highlighted by Ashutosh Sharma's unbeaten 66 off 31 balls. KL Rahul missed the match to be with his wife Athiya Shetty for the birth of their daughter. The squad celebrated the news with a heartwarming dance, reflecting the joyous mood in the dressing room.

title: Watch: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, Rabri Devi’s heated exchange in council
content: A heated exchange occurred in the Bihar Legislative Council between Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and Leader of Opposition Rabri Devi over reservation issues. Protests by RJD members in green T-shirts led to Kumar calling the protest 'bogus' and making personal remarks about Devi's tenure as Chief Minister, provoking a strong response from the opposition.

title: Goalkeeper pushes ball boy to the ground during match - WATCH
content: Carrick Rangers goalkeeper Jack McIntyre has apologised for shoving a ball boy during a match against Cliftonville. Despite video evidence, the referee did not penalize McIntyre. The club and McIntyre have expressed regret, and investigations by the Northern Ireland Police Service are ongoing. Any internal disciplinary actions will remain confidential.

title: Cash-at-home case: SC panel reaches Delhi HC judge Varma's residence for inquiry
content: A Supreme Court panel is investigating the alleged cash recovery at Delhi HC judge Yashwant Varma's residence following a storeroom fire. The inquiry led to a recommendation for his transfer but is declared independent of an ongoing investigation.

title: India slaps Samsung with $601 million tax demand
content: India’s tax authorities have demanded $601 million from Samsung and its local executives for alleged tariff evasion on telecommunications equipment imports. Despite Samsung’s efforts to contest the classification and abandon the investigation, customs officials have allegedly found violations.

title: Latest health update on former Bangladesh skipper Tamim Iqbal
content: Former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal, 36, regained consciousness after a major heart attack during a domestic match. He was leading Mohammedan Sporting Club when rushed to the hospital on Monday. The cricket community, including Shakib Al Hasan and Yuvraj Singh, expressed support. He is now stable, having undergone surgery to clear an artery blockage.

title: Dowry, domestic abuse: Woman strangled by husband in UK, kin fight for justice
content: Harshita Brella, a 24-year-old Delhi resident, was murdered in the UK by her husband, Pankaj Lamba, after enduring severe domestic abuse. Despite her family's pleas, Harshita couldn't return to India due to legal constraints. Her family seeks justice, emphasizing her husband's premeditated intentions and dowry-related threats.

title: Disha Salian case: FIR against Aaditya Thackeray, Rhea Chakraborty & others
content: An FIR has been filed against Aaditya Thackeray, Rhea Chakraborty, and others in connection with Disha Salian's death. Salian's father alleges political cover-up and demands a fresh CBI investigation. Disha, former manager to Sushant Singh Rajput, died under suspicious circumstances in June 2020, just six days before Rajput's death.

title: Delhi HC asks for inquiry report on an arrest by U.P. police in Delhi
content: The court had previously observed that inter-State arrests couldn’t be effected without following the proper protocol

title: Boating launched in Sanna Kere in Yadgir
content: The district administration, the ZP, Tourism Department and Vinyog Ventures Private Limited have launched the service in Lumbini Garden

title: How will Trump’s decision to impose tariff on countries buying Venezuelan oil impact India
content: India’s current import dependence when it comes to crude oil, which includes supply from Venezuela, means Mr. Trump’s latest plans will add to the country’s tariff burden

title: Three children feared drown in U.P.'s Shahjahanpur
content: Police arrived at the scene with a flood unit and trained divers, but the children have not been found yet.

title: Rail traffic restored at accident site of bullet train project in Gujarat
content: After the segmental launching gantry was lifted, the first train passed on the rail line at 5.36 am on Tuesday, March 25, an official from the Western Railway's Ahmedabad division said.

title: Actor Sonu Sood's wife Sonali injured in Nagpur highway crash
content: Sonu Sood's wife, Sonali (54), and her sister, Sumita Salve (55), were injured in a car accident on the Mumbai-Nagpur highway. Their car collided with a stationary truck. Both are hospitalized. Separately, a Ludhiana court issued an arrest warrant for Sonu Sood in a Rs 10 lakh fraud case, involving a fake Rijika coin investment.

title: 'Grenades, sleeping bags recovered': Security forces comb J&K Kathua for terrorists
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district found weapons, grenades, and supplies while searching for terrorists hiding in the forested area. On the operation's third day, troops engaged in gunfire after detecting suspicious movement. The Special Operations Group acted on intelligence about terrorists hiding in a local nursery. The area remains under tight security.

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta tables Rs 1 lakh crore budget: Key details
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta presented the 2025-26 state budget, allocating Rs 1 lakh crore for various initiatives. Key allocations include Rs 5,100 crore for women empowerment, Rs 750 crore for free laptops, and significant funds for infrastructure, health, and cleaning the Yamuna River.

title: Bihar Board Class 12th result released: Direct link to check
content: The Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB) announced the Class 12 results for 2025 on March 25. Students can check their results on the official BSEB website or through the Times of India portal. This year, the overall pass percentage and stream-specific statistics were shared, highlighting top performers in Science, Arts, and Commerce. The exams were conducted from February 1 to February 15, 2025, across 1,677 centres in Bihar. The Board has also announced the stream-wise toppers.

title: How not to lose money in small-cap MFs: Do SIPs for at least 12 years
content: Investors in small cap mutual funds should commit to SIPs for at least 10-12 years to mitigate potential losses, as found by Valuemetrics Technologies' analysis. Long-term investments reduce short-term volatility, increasing the chances of positive returns amid fluctuating market conditions.

title: Leaked war chat: Full list of participants in 'Houthi PC small group'
content: In a stunning breach of protocol, senior members of the Trump administration planned and executed a military strike on Yemen through a Signal group chat that accidentally included a journalist. The encrypted thread, titled “Houthi PC small group,” brought together some of the most powerful figures in US national security—alongside The Atlantic’s editor in chief, Jeffrey Goldberg, who was mistakenly added to the conversation. Over several days, officials casually discussed war plans, debated timing, and celebrated the eventual airstrikes—all on a platform not authorized for classified communications.

title: Sitting on a treasure? This Rs 1 note could fetch you Rs 7 lakh
content: Old currency notes and coins, especially from British India or early post-independence, are fetching lakhs in auctions due to their historical importance and rarity. Platforms like Coin Bazaar, Quikr, and eBay are popular for trading these collectibles. Collectors value notes with printing errors, distinct serial numbers, and signatures from notable officials.

title: New process to retrieve unclaimed bank deposits soon
content: Banks in India are set to introduce a new format to help recover unclaimed deposits worth over ₹78,213 crore. The new guidelines will require banks to display unclaimed deposit details online and streamline the reclaim process, making it fully operational by FY26.

title: March Madness Day 4: Updates, analysis as women's Sweet 16 is set
content: the women's Sweet 16 is set for a round-of-32 matchup between the no. 1 seeds Texas and the USC . the win was far overshadowed by the injury to player of the year contender JuJu Watkins .

title: First bets for the men's Sweet 16
content: the Sweet 16 is set in the men's NCAA tournament . there are no true Cinderellas left but there are plenty of compelling matchups . the best bets are accurate as of publication time . despite the best defense in the country, their offense is what should make the difference .

title: There's a new No. 1 in the women's Sweet 16 rerankings
content: uConn beat south Dakota State in the 2025 women's NCAA tournament . a torn ACL in her right knee is a season-ending injury . americans haven't reached the regionals, but there is plenty of movement in the rankings .

title: After fluctuating weather conditions, rise in temperatures forecast for Telangana
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: NCAA men's hockey roundtable: Teams, players to watch, plus Frozen Four picks
content: ten of the 16 teams are from the two strongest conferences in the country . most of the usual suspects of the past few seasons are here . three no. 3 seeds -- Denver, Quinnipiac and UMass -- have recent national championship banners that show they know what it takes to win it all .

title: From Cooper Flagg to Derik Queen: Montverde Academy impacting men's NCAA tournament
content: a 3-pointer puts Colorado State ahead with six seconds left . this time last year, Montverde (Florida) Academy was sitting atop the ESPN SCNext top 25 high school basketball rankings . former coach Kevin Boyle recently took over as head coach at SPIRE Academy in Ohio .

title: Jimmy Butler's Miami coffee shop posts special prices -- for Warriors employees
content: former Miami Heat forward's first brick-and-mortar location for his coffee brand, "Big Face Coffee" opened in December in the city's design district . prices typically range from $4 to $10 for drinks, according to a post of the menu on Yelp .

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: the Rebels remain in the top spot after a strong performance on the road against Alabama, going 2-1 in Tuscaloosa . UC Irvine is the highest-ranked newcomer at no. 19, followed by no. 23 Arizona, which has bounced in and out of the rankings a bit this year .

title: Road to the men's Frozen Four: Complete schedule, teams at a glance
content: the 2025 men's hockey tournament is set, with the 16-team bracket in place . all games will air on the ESPN networks and stream on ESPN+ . the winners of the six conference tournaments win automatic NCAA berths .

title: Breaking down strengths and weakness of every Way-Too-Early Top 25 team
content: our college football experts break down every team's strength and weakness . the Buckeyes have arguably the top offensive and defensive players returning in college football in wide receiver Jeremiah Smith and safety Caleb Downs .

title: Forecaster for Week 1: March 27-30
content: fantasy baseball managers in leagues with daily transactions will lock at the scheduled start time of each player's game on any given day . if you have not yet drafted, keep in mind that players will be locked in the roster spots you select them with . all Cubs and Dodgers from the Tokyo Series will still be able to start, sit, IL, add and/or drop Cubs .
